name: Icelandair Hotel Reykjavik Natura

reviews.title: Very good amenities at this hotel.
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in November 2013 after a very tiring airplane trip from Toronto. The beds were very comfortable, the room spotless, and the bathroom (although small and a tiny bit weathered - some small chips in the enamelled floor of the shower) was more than adequate. A rain head shower head and unlimited hot water was fabulous after a nap. The food was quite good and the coffee although different looking was delicious. The Staff are fantastic!

Spent 3 nights here in October/November 2013 as part of a group! Hotel is a bit out from the city but suited our needs perfectly! We even had a Northern Light show out the back of the hotel one night, the hotel provided us with blankets etc to sit out and enjoy it! Breakfast had a huge selection and the staff were very friendly! Our visit was short and busy so didn't get a chance to avail of all the facilities but cannot complain about anything!
reviews.title: Perfect for a short stay!

reviews.text: Will definitely be back!

reviews.title: Bad location, outdated rooms.

reviews.text: I spent a couple of nights here. As others have said, this is a corporate/business-style hotel, and a pretty good example of the genre. Staff were consistently polite and helpful, and all (as almost everywhere in Iceland) spoke good English. (No bad thing as few visitors speak even a smattering of Icelandic!)
reviews.title: Good business-style hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was decently furnished, with coffee-making facilities (although my room had only a couple of small packets of cheap instant) and a comfortable chair. Oddly, for hotels of this style, there was nowhere to put a bag whilst I unpacked, so I had to use the bed. Not a problem, but the lack will surely lead to more wear and tear. There was plenty of hot water, but the shower was closed by a curtain, with some water inevitably landing up on the floor outside.
reviews.title: Magical Iceland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was typical of similar northern European hotels, and the food was of a better standard than I have found at many. Flasks of coffee (ok, not outstanding) were available for guests to take to their tables.
reviews.title: Incredible Iceland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location may not be ideal for everyone, as it is near the Reykjavik domestic airport (NOT the international airport at Keflavik) and the long-distance bus station on the outskirts of town.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was very nice. We got a basic room (for two) which was small but very clean. The bed was very comfortable with a nice fluffy down duvet. It is not in the downtown area which was fine for us. There is a bus that is right across the street that will take you into town or you can walk the 20 minutes into town if you prefer. The hotel provides a free bus pass - you need to ask for it. The breakfast buffet is very inclusive and you should take advantage of it (hours 7:00 to 10:00) because food is very expensive in Iceland; about $22.00 for a hamburger - to give you an example. I would definitely go back to this hotel if I get the chance to visit Iceland again. Had a wonderful time.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
Pleasant hotel
reviews.text: Pros: free bus pass for duration of stay, nice lounge with a happy hour, morning breakfast had plenty of choices, very clean, tour desk in hotel, helpful staff, tours will pick you up at the hotel, fun Thursday night story time with hot coca, plenty of seating in lobby and lounge area

reviews.title: attentive and friendly staff
reviews.text: Cons: next to domestic airport noise, no restaurants close by other than one in hotel, walk to town was not as easy as you would expect as it was across busy roads and lacked some sidewalks, no shops close by, charge to use pool and hot tub

reviews.title: Very Enjoyable
reviews.text: We stayed @ the Natura 01/11/2013 - 04/11/2013 , as a family of 5. The hotel was within a short walk of the city centre. The staff were very freindly, attentive and helpful. The hotel itself was clean, warm and comfortable. The spa was a terrific treat!!! Although there were slight cue @ the restaurant, the service afterwards and the food were perfect. Again, I have to say that the staff were brilliant!!!

reviews.title: Below average
reviews.text: Just returned from a four-night stay at Hotel Natura. It exceeded my expectations...the rooms were clean, restaurant had very good food, spa was wonderful, and the staff were always friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends. the only down-side was the location.

reviews.title: Nice amenities, but little access...
reviews.text: I stayed at the Icelandair Natura hotel for three nights for a conference held at the hotel.

description: Four-star Reykjavik accommodation showcasing the best of Icelandic nature. Newly-renovated Icelandair Hotel Reykjavík Natura (formerly Hotel Loftleidir) is close to the city centre, in the quiet Oskjuhlid wooded area near the sea.
